revised_title: Temperature Effects on the Specific Inductive Capacity of Dielectrics
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to understand the effect of temperature on the specific inductive capacity of dielectrics. They observed an increase in the capacity of a glass condenser when heated and compared the effects of temperature on specific inductive capacity and refractive index. The results showed that the specific inductive capacity of a substance has a maximum value near its melting point.
